section.name: Introduction
section.p: DNA components have associated metadata that declares what resources they need to be provided and what resources they are capable of providing to other components.

Historically there has been several different mechanisms for associating metadata with a component. DNA attempts to learn from past mistakes and make the metadata format extensible to future needs and while still simple to use. To achieve this goal the JDK 1.5 Annotation framework has been used to enable runtime access of component metadata.

The annotation framework means that a developer can annotate the source code of their components to define the metadata associated with the component. The annotations defined for the DNA framework are described in the MetaData Model document.
